intro: Phalangium revolutum, commonly known as the curled phalangium, is a species of millipede belonging to the family Polydesmidae. It is characterized by its elongated, segmented body and numerous pairs of legs, typical of millipedes. The exoskeleton of Phalangium revolutum is usually dark in color, providing camouflage in its natural habitat. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as under logs or in leaf litter. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a decomposer, contributing to nutrient cycling in forest ecosystems.
